front.title: The OAuth 2.0 Bearer Token Usage over the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP)

abstract.t: This specification describes how to use OAuth 2.0 bearer tokens to access protected resources using the Constrained Application Protocol (CoAP). Any party in possession of a bearer token (a "bearer") can use it to get access to the associated resources (without demonstrating possession of a cryptographic key). To prevent misuse, bearer tokens need to be protected from disclosure in storage and in transport.
